definition: to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: The adjustment can be seen seven emotions, physical well-being is very important.
sentences.chinese: 可見七情的調適，對身體安康很重要。

sentences.english: In the next place, the university students should also display main function in the course of relationship adjustment.
sentences.chinese: 首先要發揮高校政工幹部在調適關係中的主導性作用。

sentences.english: You can perform most of your usual cardio and toning workouts right in the water.
sentences.chinese: 在水中，你可以進行大多數心臟和調適性鍛鍊項目。

sentences.english: His oft-cited article is "The Science of 'Muddling Through".
sentences.chinese: 他的被經常引用的文章是“漸進調適的科學”。

sentences.english: The effect of expatriate's extraversion on expatriate adjustment is significantly positive.
sentences.chinese: 派外人員外向性對派外調適程度有顯著正向影響。

definition: attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
to adjust/to regulate/to harmonize/to reconcile (accountancy etc)
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to remove/to step back from involvement/to disengage
to throw out/to get rid of
